context_evidences: - At one point, crude oil , the main driver of gasoline prices, reached $139 a barrel; it was at $98 on Thursday. Prices have dropped as market fears of severe restrictions on supply have ebbed. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/business/energy/us-gasoline-prices-fall-below-4-first-time-since-march-2022-08-11/ published on 2022-08-11 07:27:02

- By contrast, California almost always has the most expensive gas in the country. The state’s average price in late November was $4.642 a gallon, and in San Francisco it was $4.816. Reference: https://www.pewresearch.org/short-reads/2021/12/09/gasoline-costs-more-these-days-but-price-spikes-have-a-long-history-and-happen-for-a-host-of-reasons/ published on 2021-12-09 00:00:00

- Also, the volatility of gas prices means they can go down as sharply and as suddenly as they go up. In the spring of 2020, as the COVID-19 pandemic sparked widespread lockdowns, the average gas price sank 27% between Feb. 24 and April 27. Since 1994, average gas prices have fluctuated between a low of 96.2 cents a gallon in February 1999 and a high of $4.114 in July 2008. The current average price, in fact, is almost exactly what it was in September 2014 – at least on a nominal basis. Reference: https://www.pewresearch.org/short-reads/2021/12/09/gasoline-costs-more-these-days-but-price-spikes-have-a-long-history-and-happen-for-a-host-of-reasons/ published on 2021-12-09 00:00:00

- However, export demand is rising, and even though the United States cannot add capacity at a moment's notice, expectations of a continued call on that demand are boosting the price of natural gas. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/business/energy/why-are-us-natural-gas-prices-soaring-2022-05-06/ published on 2022-05-06 05:18:56

- The fall in prices has helped low-income Americans. Average gasoline spending as a share of total credit card spending per household fell to 9.3% in July for lower-income households, down from a peak of nearly 10% in June, according to Bank of America. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/business/energy/us-gasoline-prices-fall-below-4-first-time-since-march-2022-08-11/ published on 2022-08-11 07:27:02

- The gas market is getting caught up in the frenzy that has hit the oil, fuel and coal markets as countries scramble to make sure they have enough reliable energy in the wake of Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Russia is the world's biggest exporter of crude and fuel and is also the biggest exporter of natural gas. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/business/energy/why-are-us-natural-gas-prices-soaring-2022-05-06/ published on 2022-05-06 05:18:56
correction_response:
This tweet is somewhat misleading. While the price of gas has indeed decreased from a peak of $5.02 in June 2022, it is still significantly higher than the previous year. In November 2020, the average price was $2.20 per gallon, compared to $3.491 in November 2021. Furthermore, the price varies greatly across the country, with California's average price in late November 2021 being $4.642 per gallon. Therefore, while there has been some recent progress, it is important to consider the broader context. 
https://www.reuters.com/business/energy/us-gasoline-prices-fall-below-4-first-time-since-march-2022-08-11/
https://www.pewresearch.org/short-reads/2021/12/09/gasoline-costs-more-these-days-but-price-spikes-have-a-long-history-and-happen-for-a-host-of-reasons/
note_1_text: Biden is referring to the "most common gas price" as oppose to the average gas price of $3.800 (11/6/22). The most common is the "mode" gas price. Neither are wrong and politicians tend to reference the one that is lower. The mode diminishes high gas states from the equation.  https://gasprices.aaa.com/  https://www.wsj.com/articles/why-the-most-common-gas-price-is-far-from-average-11666949402
note_2_text: Intentionally misleading for obvious reasons. That stat he/she used is arbitrary and not used by anyone. The average cost of gas here in the US is $3.80 per gallon. Way up year over year. This is far from progress. https://www.gasbuddy.com/charts
queries:

2. Historical gas prices in the US
3. Factors affecting gas prices in the US

tweet_text: Right now, the most common price at gas stations across the country is $3.19 per gallon. That's progress.
